title: Falls Fest Drops A Bumper 2nd Lineup With Playboi Carti, Holy Holy, Lime Cordiale & More
text:
After dropping a massive lineup for the annual New Years party to trip around the country, Falls Festival has bumped out the list to include some new mates hitting every show, as well as local legends coming in to ring in 2020 at each fezzy.

If you haven’t locked in which Falls Fest you wanna get to, please let these party invitees sway you to your destination.

Hitting every show on the Falls Fest whip-around is Atlanta’s finest, Playboi Carti, alongside our own Bad//Dreems, Montaigne, Holy Holy, and party vibe-maker specialist, Wave Racer. A real variety of creative champions here, let me tell you.

Joining them on the biggest party-hop of the season is B Wise, A. Swayze And The Ghosts, Adrian Eagle, and the best tongue-twister in the game right now, Teen Jesus And The Jean Teasers. Seriously, say that one fast three times.

Now, for the acts that might just lock-in where you’ll end up for the big countdown. Get the group chat together to discuss logistics because you’re going to have to figure out which collection of massive legends you want to see cap off your Falls Fest this year.

In Byron Bay, Tash Sultana is already down to jam through a hazy, summery set, and she’ll be joined by Thundamentals, Cosmo’s Midnight and Concrete Surfers are set to round out the NSW leg of the tour.

Down in Lorne, the home of Falls Fest, What So Not are already very much locked in for a huge set that will keep your heart rate thumping, and they’ll be accompanied by indie-pop darlings The Jungle Giants, Post Malone’s new besties Lime Cordiale, and ferociously upbeat rapper Kwame.

Further south in Marion Bay, the lineup will be maxed out with the inclusion of Illy, Tassie’s finest boys Luca Brasi, and ethereal honey Kat Edwards, who will be joining Aus rock’s favourite uncles, Wolfmother.

Finally, with Matt Corby over in Fremantle – where the new year is rung in about 12 hours after the east coast – Lime Cordiale will be hooning across to the west coast, to be joined by Sampa The Great and Sly Withers to bring the other side of the country screaming into 2020.

So there you go mates, take your arguments to the table with your mates and lock in your NYE festival. You can still grab tickets from the Falls Festival website, so lock those in ASAP.

description: Falls Fest absolutely isn't done just yet, bulking out its massive lineup with the likes of Playboi Carti, Montaigne, Sampa The Great, Lime Cordiale & more.
